Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic epistolary text: 23 ll. on recto, 1 l. (address) on verso; complete. Letter reiterating an offer to stand surety for a subordinate who is in prison.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Serapeum ((suggested with doubt by Thompson's MS Catalogue))
Curator's comments: Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Letter written by Harendotes son of Hor to Heriubastis, the chief of police(?). Date. year 22 of Ptol. Philometor. Choiak 21 = BC. 159. Jan. 20." Publ. Revillout. Corp. Pap. ll. pl. ll and rev.eg. V 46, Sethe, Bungtehaftsurkunden(?) p. 410 req. pl. 50-52. Published by Depauw, The Demotic Letter (2006), 29 with bibliography. EA 10785-6 probably form an archive with 10231, 10242, 10405-6 (Muhs, pers. comm.).
Bibliographic references: Revillout 1888 / Papyrus Démotiques du British Museum, Premier Fascicule (p.2-3, pl.2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43897) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43897)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (cracked) Sandwich: board Window verso Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
